item.title: OYD Chapter 1: Personal Cloud
item.description: This is part of my owngoing series on Owning Your Data. Check out the Prolog here! Clouds can be light and fluffy. They can also be… not. One massive convience (and source of lock in) offered by major tech players is Cloud Storage. Its a big deal because its (relatively) easy to set up, has predictable costs, and produces lots of recurring revenue. In this first dive into personal data ownership, I’m going to walk through setting up and using an open-source alternative to offerings like DropBox and iCloud: SyncThing.
